2 ^ Dòmine: 3 ^ Qŭóniam sagìttaĕ tuaĕ infíxaĕ sunt mìhi
ne in furóre tuo árguas me: et confirmavìsti super me manum tuam. ^ For thy arrows are fastened in me
nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: and thy hand hath been strong upon me.

2 ^ Dòmine: 4 ^ Non est sánitas in carne mea
ne in furóre tuo árguas me: a fácie iraĕ tuaĕ~; non est pax òssibus meîs a fácie peccatórum meórum. ^ There is no health in my flesh
nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: because of thy wrath~; there is no peace for my bones

2 ^ Dòmine: 5 ^ Qŭóniam iniqŭitátes meaĕ supergrèssaĕ sunt caput meum
ne in furóre tuo árguas me: et sicut onus grave gravátaĕ sunt super me. ^ For my iniquities are gone over my head
nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: and as a heavy burden are become heavy upon me.

2 ^ Dòmine: 6 ^ Putruérunt et corrùptaĕ sunt cicatríces meaĕ
ne in furóre tuo árguas me: a fácie insapièntiaĕ meaĕ. ^ My sores are putrefied and corrupted

2 ^ Dòmine: 7 ^ Mìser factus sum et curvátus sum usqŭe in finem~; tota die contristátus ingrediébar. ^ I am become miserable
ne in furóre tuo árguas me: and am bowed down even to the end~; I walked sorrowful all the day long.

2 ^ Dòmine: 8 ^ Qŭóniam lumbi mei impléti sunt illusiónibus
ne in furóre tuo árguas me: et non est sánitas in carne mea. ^ For my loins are filled with illusions~; and there is no health in my flesh.
et humiliátus sum nìmis~; rugiébam a gèmitu cordis mei. ^ I am afflicted and humbled exceedingly~; I roared with the groaning of my heart.

nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: et gèmitus meus a te non est abscònditus. ^ Lord
O Lord: all my desire is before thee
in thy indignation~; nor chastise me in: and my groaning is not hidden from thee.

2 ^ Dòmine: 11 ^ Cor meum conturbátum est~; derelíquit me virtûs mea
nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: et ipsum non est mecum. ^ My heart is troubled
in thy indignation~; nor chastise me in: and the light of my eyes itself is not with me.

2 ^ Dòmine: 12 ^ Amíci mei et pròximi mei advèrsum me appropinquavérunt et stetérunt
nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: de longe stetérunt. ^ My friends and my neighbours have drawn near and stood against me
O Lord: and they that were near me stood afar off.

2 ^ Dòmine: 13 ^ Et vim faciébant qŭi qŭaĕrébant ánimam meam
O Lord: et dolos tota die meditabántur. ^ And they that sought my soul used violence
in thy indignation~; nor chastise me in: and they that sought evils to me
column7: and studied deceits all the day long.

O Lord: et sicut mutus non apèriens os suum. ^ But I
column7: and as a dumb man not opening his mouth.

2 ^ Dòmine: 15 ^ Et factus sum sicut hòmo non áŭdiens
ne in furóre tuo árguas me: et non habens in ore suo redargutiónes. ^ And I became as a man that heareth not
nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: and that hath no reproofs in his mouth.

2 ^ Dòmine: 16 ^ Qŭóniam in te Dòmine sperávi~; tu exáŭdies me Dòmine Deus meus. ^ For in thee
nèqŭe in ira tua corrìpias me. ^ Rebuke: have I hoped~; thou wilt hear me

O Lord: super me magna locúti sunt. ^ For I said
in thy indignation~; nor chastise me in: "Lest at any time my enemies rejoice over me
column6:
and whilst my feet are moved, they speak great things against me.
18 ^ Qŭóniam ego in flagèlla parátus sum, et dolor meus in conspèctu meo semper. ^ For I am ready for scourges, and my sorrow is continually before me.
19 ^ Qŭóniam iniqŭitátem meam adnuntiábo, et cogitábo pro peccáto meo. ^ For I will declare my iniquity, and I will think for my sin.
20 ^ Inimíci aŭtem mei vivunt, et confirmáti sunt super me, et multiplicáti sunt qŭi odérunt me iníqŭe. ^ But my enemies live, and are stronger than I, and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
21 ^ Qŭi retrìbuunt mala pro bonîs, detrahébant mìhi, qŭóniam sequébar bonitátem. ^ They that render evil for good, have detracted me, because I followed goodness.
22 ^ Ne derelìnqŭas me, Dòmine Deus meus~; ne discèsserîs a me. ^ For sake me not, O Lord my God~; be not withdrawn from me.
23 ^ Intènde in adjutórium meum, Dòmine, Deus salútis meaĕ. ^ Attend unto my help, O Lord, the God of my salvation.
